channel.title: Table Import on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Table Import on 0x000216

item.title: Lesson Learned: Tax Details Importation
item.description:
A client recently inquired about manually setting up numerous tax details in Dynamics GP during a testing phase. Since this involved both a live and a test database, manual setup would be doubly time-consuming. Opting for a supposedly “quick” table import, a mistake was made. While table imports themselves are not problematic, the assumption of speed was. Importing to the Sales/Purchases Tax Master (TX00201) table requires careful attention. Manually setting up a record beforehand is crucial to understand the appropriate settings for all fields, many of which have specific default values needed for the import...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/lesson-learned-tax-details-importation/

item.title: Importing tables is not always seen as the less attractive option.
item.description:
I usually avoid using table imports and prefer alternative methods like Integration Manager, direct SQL queries, or eConnect whenever possible. However, I’m reminded from time to time about the simplicity and effectiveness of this approach. Recently, I’ve been working on a project with a tight deadline, striving to minimize manual data entry. I encountered several instances where Integration Manager wasn’t suitable for importing data, making table import a valuable solution. I successfully used it to import data into straightforward tables like:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/importing-tables-is-not-always-seen-as-the-less-attractive-option/
